title: Korean-Style Gochujang Pork Bibimbap with Spinach Rice
keywords: Bibimbap, Gochujang, Pork, Korean, Spinach rice, Spicy, Rice bowl

method.step: Add your white long grain rice to a pot with a lid with your ml cold water to a pot with a lit and bring to the boil over a heigh heat
Once boiling reduce the heat to very low and cook, covered for 10-12 minutes or until all the water has been absorbed and the rice is cooked
Once done, remove from the heat and set aside (lid on) to steam until serving
Heat a large wide based pan with a drizzle of vegetable oil and heigh heat
Once hot, add your pork mince with a pinch of salt and pepper and cook for 8-10 minutes or until cooked through, brown and crispy breaking to up with a wooden spoon as you go
Cut you cucumber in half lengthways, then slice finely
Combine your gochujang paste and tomato ketchup in a bowl with you tbsp cold water.  This is your gochujang ketchup
Once the pork is cooked add half the gochujang ketchup to the pan and stir it all together in fully coated.  This is your gochujang pork
Once the pork is coated, push the gochujang pork to one side of the pan and crack your egg(s) into the other side
Cover with a lid and cook fir 2-3 minutes or until done to your liking
(give your egg a little shake before you crack for a perfectly centred yolk)
Wash your spinach and pat it dry with kitchen paper
Add your toasted sesame oil and spinach to the pot with the cooked rice with a pinch of salt and give everything a good mix up until the spinach starts to wilt.  This is your spinach rice
Serve the gochujang pork with the spinach rice and spiced cucumber to the side and top with the friend egg(s).  this is your Korean style gochujang pork bibimbap
Drizzle over the remaining gochujang ketchup and garnish with your toasted sesame seeds
